title: Raspberry-Rose Jam, Orange Blossom Buttercream Macaron
subtitle: These macarons have a light orange blossom buttercream with a sharp raspberry rose jam center.
subtitle2: These macarons always turn out perfectly baked. They are flavored to perfect with the rosewater and orange blossom without being overpowering. While this recipe can be a little tricky, trust me it's worth it!
steps: Line ^2 cookie sheets with parchment paper$
Combine the almond flour and powder sugar. Sift the mixture into a ^large bowl$ to remove any lumps
Add !egg-white-almond and mix into the almond-sugar mixture to form a paste
Add a few drops of pink food gel coloring. This is optional.
In a stand mixer, beat the remaining !egg-white-fluffy until soft peaks form.
Combine the white sugar and water in a ^small saucepan$. Bring to boil over low heat, and heat until it reaches 115°C using a candy thermometer. You must use a candy thermometer.
Remove from heat, and slowly drizzle into the ^stand mixer$ with the beaten egg while beating on low speed.
Mix on high for about 3 min or until the bowl is cool and stiff peaks form. You should be able to turn the bowl upside down without the meringue falling out.
Fold the meringue into the almond-sugar paste mixture. Use your spatula to press onto the sides of the bowl to remove any lumps.
Mix until you have a smooth batter that runs off of the spatula slowly in a thick ribbon
Put mixture in ^piping bag$. Pipe small 1 ½ inch circles onto the lined baking tray. I normally get !cookie.
Pipe thre circle by holding the piping bag upright with the tip just above the sheet, and pipe without pulling your hand up or moving it in circles.
Tap the baking sheets a few times on the counter to remove any air bubbles
Let the cookies sit out for 30 minutes to dry
Preheat the oven to 300°F
Bake cookies for 18 min. Remove from the oven and let them completely cool on cooling racks before removing from the parchment paper. They will stick when warm.

To make the buttercream, beat the butter until the butter has lightened and becomes creamy. Add the powder sugar and beat for 5 minutes. Add the orange blossom water, vanilla bean paste, heavy cream and salt and beat for 30 sec.
Fill a piping bag with the buttercream and set aside.

To make the raspberry rose jam, place raspberries, granulated sugar, water, and pinch of salt in a saucepan. Place the saucepan over medium heat. Using a spoon mash up the raspberries. Let the mixture come to a boil and thicken. We want the jam to be quite thick so it doesn't spread. Remove from heat and add the rose water.

To assemble, first pair up all of the macaron halves. Next use a little buttercream and spread on both the top and bottom macaron using a butter knife. Pipe little dots of buttercream around the perimeter of the bottom macaron, leaving a hole in the center. Spoon a little jam into the center. Place the top cookie.
Refridgerate in an air-tight container for at least 1-2 days before serving. This allows the cookies to absorb a little bit of the flavors. Trust me it is worth it!
